title: 111_hr3229
content: SECTION 1. ALEXANDER CREEK VILLAGE RECOGNITION. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to include recognition of Alexander Creek Village. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to recognize Alexander Creek as an eligible Native village under specific terms and definitions. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to define key terms related to Alexander Creek, including Alexander Creek Incorporated, property, Region, and CIRI Property Account. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of the Interior, shall establish the 'Alexander Creek account' funded within 24 months. Funds in the account can be used by Alexander Creek for bidding on and purchasing property in Alaska at public sales, remaining available until expended. Alexander Creek can bid on property in Alaska at public sales and purchase it according to applicable laws and regulations. The Alexander Creek account, established by the Secretary of the Treasury in consultation with the Secretary of the Interior, allows for transactions where any amount tendered is accepted as cash. The account balance is adjusted accordingly. Procedures are set for deposit receipts, escrow deposits, and reinstatement of unused escrow deposits. The initial balance is based on the fair market value determined by appraisal. The fair market value of the surface estate of approximately 61,440 acres of deficiency selections previously made by Alexander Creek is determined by an appraisal. The parcels of land included in this valuation are listed in detail. The listed parcels of land for valuation include various sections in different townships and ranges. The parcels of land for valuation are located in different townships and ranges, including sections in T. 7 S., R. 29 W., sec. 12, T. 8 S., R. 29 W., sec. 1, T. 8 S., R. 29 W., secs. 3-4, T. 8 S., R. 29 W., secs. 8-20, T. 2 N., R. 20 W., sec. 13, T. 1 N., R. 27 W., sec. 8, T. 1 N., R. 27 W., sec. 16, T. 1 N., R. 27 W., secs. 20-23, T. 1 N., R. 27 W., sec. 25, T. 1 N., R. 27 W., sec. 36, T. 1 N., R. 28 W., secs. 1-2, T. 1 N., R. 28 W., secs. 8-11, T. 1 N., R. 28 W., secs. 16-18, T. 3 S., R. 23 W., sec. 8, T. 3 S., R. 23 W., sec. 26, T. 3 S., R. 23 W., sec. 33, T. 6 S., R. 24 W., secs. 27-28, and T. 7 S., R. 28 W., secs. 4-7. The parcels of land for valuation are located in various townships and ranges, including sections in T. 7 S., R. 28 W., secs. 4 through 7, T. 7 S., R. 28 W., secs. 10 and 11, T. 7 S., R. 28 W., secs. 14 and 15, T. 7 S., R. 28 W., sec. 22, T. 8 S., R. 29 W., sec. 5, T. 2 N., R. 20 W., sec. 30, T. 3 N., R. 20 W., sec. 2, T. 3 N., R. 20 W., sec. 13, T. 4 N., R. 20 W., sec. 33, T. 2 N., R. 27 W., secs. 10 through 12, T. 11 N., R. 28 W., secs. 16 through 27, T. 2 N., R. 30 W., sec. 12, T. 1 S., R. 20 W., sec. 4, T. 3 S., R. 23 W., sec. 17, T. 3 S., R. 23 W., sec. 28, T. 6 S., R. 24 W., secs. 14, 21, and 26. The CIRI Property Account will be increased by the fair market value of approximately 61,440 acres of deficiency selections made by Alexander Creek, with the value not less than 61,440 multiplied by the acre equivalent value of the Region's entitlement. The CIRI Property Account will be increased by the fair market value of approximately 61,440 acres of deficiency selections made by Alexander Creek, multiplied by the acre equivalent value of the Region's entitlement lands. The funds added to the account will be segregated and negotiations will be held for a land exchange to acquire additional public lands for Alexander Creek. The subsurface lands within Alexander Creek's original withdrawal area in Alaska will be conveyed to the Region without consideration. Any land exchange must be approved by Alexander Creek and completed within 36 months. If a conveyance of surface estate is made to Alexander Creek, their account will be reduced by the actual acres conveyed multiplied by the average value per acre. If a conveyance of subsurface estate is made to the Region, the CIRI Property Account will be affected. The CIRI Property Account will be reduced by the actual acres conveyed multiplied by the average value per acre of the subsurface acres appraised. The Secretary will separately appraise the fair market value of surface and subsurface areas for each section selected as a separate parcel. Alexander Creek and the Region can present evidence of value to the Secretary for their respective estates. The Secretary will provide Alexander Creek and the Region with a preliminary draft of the appraisal, allowing them to comment. Certified copies of the appraisal will be forwarded to both parties. Alexander Creek has the option to assign its account to any entity with notification to the Secretaries of the Treasury and Interior. Upon completion of the appraisal process, Alexander Creek can assign its account with notification to the Secretaries of the Treasury and Interior. The assigned amount will be added to the CIRI Property Account for use. Acceptance of the terms in this section will satisfy all land entitlement claims. Upon completion of the appraisal process, Alexander Creek can assign its account to the Secretaries of the Treasury and Interior. This assignment will be added to the CIRI Property Account for use and will satisfy all land entitlement claims. Any land acquired with funds from the Alexander Creek account will be considered a conveyance under this Act. Sales under this section will be administered similarly to other Native villages, with a limitation of 2.5 percent on agents' and attorneys' fees. Upon completion of the appraisal process, Alexander Creek can assign its account to the Secretaries of the Treasury and Interior for use in satisfying all land entitlement claims. Any land acquired with these funds will be considered a conveyance under this Act. Shareholders of the Native village recognized under this section will cease to receive benefits from the Region and future resource payments will be made to the Village Corporation. The Region will not be liable for damages related to the cessation of payments to these individuals. Upon completion of the appraisal process, Alexander Creek can assign its account to the Secretaries of the Treasury and Interior for satisfying land entitlement claims. This section does not limit existing rights under contracts or diminish Alexander Creek's acreage entitlement as a Group Corporation.
